intro: Psychotria copeensis, commonly known as the Cope's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Psychotria copeensis is known for its chemical complexity, containing various alkaloids, though it is not as well-studied as other species in the genus.
